title: ICC in talks to revive India-Pakistan T20 World Cup clash
byline: The International Cricket Council is in talks with the Pakistan Cricket Board to resolve the boycott of its T20 World Cup match against India on February 15, AFP learnt Saturday.

title: Sri Lanka’s Viran Chamuditha Secures Place in ICC Under-19 World Cup Squad
byline: A four-person selection panel have determined which rising stars make Team of the Tournament after India’s win at the U19 World Cup.

title: Mechanization of Gillnet Fishing Industry Raises Environmental Concerns
byline: The mechanization of Sri Lanka’s traditional gillnet fishing industry has led to a range of environmental and livelihood concerns, according to fisheries and environmental stakeholders, the Center for Environmental Justice (CEJ) said.

title: Sri Lankan student wins bronze at Young Chef Olympiad 2026
byline: Student chef Rumira Piyasiri, who represented Sri Lanka at the 12th Young Chef Olympiad (YCO) 2026 held in India, won the bronze medal and arrived at the Bandaranaike International Airport this morning (8).

title: Historic Kangaroo route flight arrives at BIA with 142 passengers
byline: Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) yesterday warmly welcomed the arrival of the historic Kangaroo Route – Captain’s Choice Qantas Airlines flight, which touched down carrying 142 passengers.

title: Postal charges revised from tomorrow
byline: The Department of Posts has announced an increase in postal charges with effect from tomorrow (09).

title: Radiological Technologists call off planned strike
byline: The Government Radiological Technologists’ Association (GRTA) has decided to call off the trade union action that was scheduled to commence on February 9, following the Health Ministry’s move to implement key recommendations related to the Maligawatta Kidney Hospital inquiry.

title: South Jeolla apologizes after Jindo governor suggests ’importing young virgins’ from Sri Lanka, Vietnam
byline: South Jeolla has apologized for the Jindo County governor, who said the country should ’’import young virgins from Sri Lanka or Vietnam.’’

title: Ireland sense an opening as Sri Lanka search for spark
byline: Sri Lanka may be co-hosts of the T20 World Cup, but familiarity with home conditions offers little comfort as pressure mounts on Dasun Shanaka’s side ahead of their opening clash against Ireland.

title: CEJ backs ban on tractor-assisted gillnet fishing
byline: The Central Environmental Justice (CEJ) has endorsed the government’s decision to ban the use of tractor winches in Sri Lanka’s traditional gillnet fishing industry, warning that the mechanized practice has caused significant harm to coastal ecosystems and small-scale fishing livelihoods.

title: Fire breaks out at Scrap Metal shop in Galle
byline: A fire erupted at a scrap metal collection shop near Dewata Junction in Galle earlier today.

title: Over 5,000 seek medical assistance from President’s Fund
byline: The President’s Fund has received 5,277 applications for medical assistance in 2025, which is an increase by 59 percent, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Japan’s governing party projected to win snap election majority
byline: Japan’s ruling party, led by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi, is set to seal a decisive win in Sunday’s snap election, exit polls suggest.

title: Three killed in Amithirigala road accident
byline: Three people were killed in a road accident in Amithirigala, Thalduwa, this afternoon (08) when a car collided with a motorcycle, police said.

title: Seifert half-century helps NZ beat Afghanistan
byline: New Zealand pulled off their highest run chase in T20 World Cup history as they opened their Group D campaign with a five-wicket win over Afghanistan.
